title: Kale & Peas Couscous with Lentils
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Preheat the air fryer to 180°C.
Toss kale and peas with half the ghee, salt, pepper and garam masala; spread on a tray.
Season lentils and place on the tray. Air-fry for 30 min, turning once.
Cook the couscous according to pack; drain well.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Couscous or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Heat almonds in a large pan over medium-high heat.
Cook lentils 6–8 min until done; remove.
Stir-fry cabbage and broccoli with thai green curry paste 2 min; season.
Return protein to warm through 1–2 min.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Sourdough bread or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Paneer Harissa plate
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Preheat the oven to 170°C.
Toss garlic and broccoli with half the peanut butter, salt, pepper and harissa; spread on a tray.
Season paneer and place on the tray. Roast for 37 min, turning once.
Cook the whole-wheat pasta according to pack; drain well.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Whole-wheat pasta or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Black beans and Cabbage Roast
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Preheat the oven to 180°C.
Toss cabbage and spinach with half the tahini, salt, pepper and italian herbs; spread on a tray.
Season black beans and place on the tray. Roast for 30 min, turning once.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Sourdough bread or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Chickpeas Lemon & herb plate
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Prepare the fresh components on a board.
Mix chickpeas with lemon & herb and a pinch of salt.
Layer with courgette, peppers and bulgur wheat.
Cook the bulgur wheat according to pack; drain well.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Bulgur wheat or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Chicken breast and Mushrooms Pan-Fry
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Heat tahini in a large pan over medium-high heat.
Cook chicken breast 6–8 min until done; remove.
Stir-fry mushrooms and carrots with cajun blend 12 min; season.
Return protein to warm through 1–2 min.
Cook the spaghetti according to pack; drain well.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Swap Chicken for tofu to make it vegetarian.
Use Spaghetti or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Tempeh and Onion Airfry
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Preheat the air fryer to 190°C.
Toss onion and kale with half the walnuts, salt, pepper and harissa; spread on a tray.
Season tempeh and place on the tray. Air-fry for 20 min, turning once.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Sourdough bread or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.

title: Catalan Greek yogurt (0%) with Quinoa & Cabbage
hydrationTip: Add 300–500 ml water with the meal; spicy meals may need a little extra.
method: Heat rapeseed oil in a large pan over medium-high heat.
Cook greek yogurt (0%) 6–8 min until done; remove.
Stir-fry cabbage and aubergine with garam masala 33 min; season.
Return protein to warm through 1–2 min.
Cook the quinoa according to pack; drain well.
Plate the carb base, add vegetables, top with protein; drizzle remaining pan juices.
swaps: Use chicken breast instead of plant protein for an omnivore option.
Use Quinoa or switch to cauliflower rice for lower carbs.
Spice tweak: add fresh chilli for more heat or reduce spice blend for mild.
